com.flappybird.game

Class AbstractGameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flappybird.game.AbstractGameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClassicGameScreen, ExtremeGameScreen, HardGameScreen, InvertedGameScreen

    public abstract class AbstractGameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    An abstract representation of a game screen. The other modes just make minor alterations to this.

      • updateColumns

        public void updateColumns()
        Updates the list of Columns, adding a new Column whenever the last column in the list passes the column distance x coordinate, moving all of the columns, and removing Columns that run off the edge of the screen (right to left)

      • updateHighScore

        public abstract void updateHighScore(int currentScore)
        If currentScore is greater than the game screen's high score in the Game, increment the game screen's high score.
        Parameters:
        currentScore - the current score of this game screen

      • drawScore

        public void drawScore()
        Draw the score of this Game
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an int in the int array is not a member of [0, 9]

      • checkCollisions

        public void checkCollisions()
        Check if the Bird hits any columns or is out of bounds. If so, plays the slap and sad trombone sounds and kills the bird.

      • firstInRange

        public Column firstInRange()
        Returns the first Column in range. That is, the first column that the Bird hasn't passed.
        Returns:
        the column, or null if no column is found
